offsets.description: Offsets for subordinate stations relative to a reference station

reference.description: The ID of the reference station

height.description: Defines the values to add or multiply with water levels (depending on type)

high.description: Height offset/multiplier for high tide - if type is 'ratio', this is a multiplier; if 'fixed', this is an offset to add (can be negative)

low.description: Height offset/multiplier for low tide - if type is 'ratio', this is a multiplier; if 'fixed', this is an offset to add (can be negative)

time.description: Defines the time to add to when a high or low tide will occur

high.description: Time offset, in minutes, to add to the high tide (can be negative)

low.description: Time offset, in minutes, to add to the low tide (can be negative)

id.description: Unique station ID for this database only, in the format of `source/id`.

continent.description: Continent name in title case (e.g., `North America`, `Asia`, `Europe`)

region.description: ISO 3166-2 region code, if available. If not, whatever local postal codes

disclaimers.description: Any disclaimers about using this data

id.description: The identifier used by the source for this station.

published_harmonics.description: Are the harmonics from published harmonic data? False means harmonics were computed.

url.description: URL to this station's data or information in the source's website

license.description: Defines the license and whatever restrictions are placed on use of the data.

type.description: A short description of the type of license (i.e. MIT, public domain, etc)

commercial_use.description: If `true` then there are no restrictions on commercial use.

url.description: A URL to the license information

notes.description: Any additional restrictions or information on the license.

name.description: Harmonic Constituent code (i.e. M2) - should be upper-case

chart_datum.description: The chart datum key used as the vertical reference for this station (e.g., MLLW, LAT). Must match a key in the datums object.

epoch.description: The time period over which the harmonic constituents were computed

start.description: Start date of the observation period (YYYY-MM-DD format)

end.description: End date of the observation period (YYYY-MM-DD format)
